tasks.title: Remove CLI Components
tasks.description: Remove all CLI interfaces and dependencies to transform Slambed into a pure MCP server, following TDD principles to ensure proper removal and maintained test coverage.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Write tests to verify CLI components are fully removed before making changes
2. Update existing tests that depend on CLI functionality to work with the new structure
3. Ensure all MCP server tests still pass after CLI removal
4. Write tests to verify no CLI dependencies remain in the codebase
5. Verify package.json no longer contains CLI dependencies
6. Confirm bin/ directory is removed
7. Test that the entry point only exposes MCP functionality
8. Ensure the application can no longer be run as a CLI tool
9. Validate that all MCP tools are still properly registered and functional
10. Maintain at least 90% test coverage throughout the codebase after removal

Ensure that removing these segments doesn't break the core functionality.

subtasks.title: Validate and test the application without CLI components

subtasks.details: Run the application's test suite to verify that core functionality remains intact. Check for any runtime errors that might be caused by missing CLI components. Update any documentation or configuration files that reference CLI functionality. Verify that the application can be built and deployed successfully without the CLI components.

subtasks.title: Write tests to verify CLI components are fully removed
subtasks.description: Create tests that verify all CLI components have been completely removed from the codebase
subtasks.details: Write tests that check for the absence of CLI-specific files, imports, and functionality. These tests should be written before making the actual changes, following TDD principles.
subtasks.testStrategy:
1. Test for absence of bin/ directory
2. Test for absence of CLI dependencies in package.json
3. Test that attempting to use CLI commands results in appropriate errors
4. Test that the entry point only exposes MCP server functionality

subtasks.title: Update existing tests that depend on CLI functionality
subtasks.description: Identify and update any existing tests that rely on CLI components

2. Refactor tests to use MCP server interfaces instead

4. Run the updated test suite to verify all tests pass

subtasks.title: Verify and maintain test coverage
subtasks.description: Ensure test coverage remains at 90% or higher after CLI removal
subtasks.details: After removing CLI components and updating tests, run coverage reports to verify that test coverage remains at 90% or higher. Add additional tests as needed to maintain coverage levels. Focus on ensuring that all MCP server functionality is thoroughly tested.

3. Write additional tests to cover any gaps
4. Verify final coverage is at least 90% across the codebase

tasks.title: Establish Test-Driven Development (TDD) Practices and Testing Infrastructure
tasks.description: Set up comprehensive testing infrastructure including Jest configuration, test templates, naming conventions, coverage reporting with 90% threshold, pre-commit hooks, and TDD documentation to ensure all development follows test-driven principles.
tasks.details:
1. Install and configure Jest as the primary testing framework:
```bash
npm install --save-dev jest @types/jest ts-jest
```

2. Create Jest configuration file (jest.config.js):
```javascript
module.exports = {
  preset: 'ts-jest',
  testEnvironment: 'node',
  roots: ['<rootDir>/src'],
  testMatch: ['**/__tests__/**/*.ts?(x)', '**/?(*.)+(spec|test).ts?(x)'],
  collectCoverage: true,
  coverageDirectory: 'coverage',
  coverageReporters: ['text', 'lcov', 'clover'],
  coverageThreshold: {
    global: {
      branches: 90,
      functions: 90,
      lines: 90,
      statements: 90
    }
  },
  moduleFileExtensions: ['ts', 'tsx', 'js', 'jsx', 'json', 'node']
};
```

3. Create test directory structure that mirrors the source code:
```
src/
  __tests__/  # Global test utilities and mocks
  tools/
    __tests__/  # Tests for tools
    github-flow/
      __tests__/  # Tests for GitHub flow tools
    automation/
      __tests__/  # Tests for automation tools
    utilities/
      __tests__/  # Tests for utility tools
    context/
```

   - Unit test template for tools
   - Integration test template for API endpoints
   - Mock template for external dependencies

   - Files: `[component-name].test.ts`
   - Test suites: `describe('ComponentName', () => {...})`
   - Test cases: `it('should perform specific action when condition', () => {...})`

6. Set up pre-commit hooks using Husky and lint-staged:
```bash
npm install --save-dev husky lint-staged
```

7. Configure Husky in package.json:
```json
{
  "husky": {
    "hooks": {
      "pre-commit": "lint-staged"
    }
  },
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.{js,ts}": [
      "eslint --fix",
      "jest --findRelatedTests --passWithNoTests"
    ]
  }
}
```

   - Coverage requirements and reporting

```json
    "test:watch": "jest --watch",
    "test:coverage": "jest --coverage",
```

tasks.title: Implement GitHub Actions Release Workflow
tasks.description: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that automates the release process when changes are merged to main, including version detection, changelog generation, and publishing to NPM.
tasks.details:
1. Create a GitHub Actions workflow file in `.github/workflows/release.yml`:
```yaml
name: Release Workflow

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  prepare-release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      version_change: ${{ steps.version-detection.outputs.change_type }}
      current_version: ${{ steps.version-detection.outputs.current_version }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '16'
          cache: 'npm'
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Detect version change type
        id: version-detection
        run: |
          # Parse commit messages since last tag to determine change type
          COMMITS=$(git log $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0)..HEAD --pretty=format:"%s")
          
          # Default to patch
          CHANGE_TYPE="patch"
          
          # Check for minor/major indicators in commit messages
          if echo "$COMMITS" | grep -q -i "feat\|feature:"; then
            CHANGE_TYPE="minor"
          fi
          
          if echo "$COMMITS" | grep -q -i "BREAKING CHANGE\|!:"; then
            CHANGE_TYPE="major"
          fi
          
          # Get current version from package.json
          CURRENT_VERSION=$(node -p "require('./package.json').version")
          
          echo "change_type=$CHANGE_TYPE" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "current_version=$CURRENT_VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
      
      - name: Generate changelog
        id: changelog
        run: |
          # Generate changelog since last tag
          CHANGELOG=$(git log $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0)..HEAD --pretty=format:"* %s (%an)")
          echo "CHANGELOG<<EOF" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "$CHANGELOG" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "EOF" >> $GITHUB_ENV
      
      - name: Create version bump PR
        uses: peter-evans/create-pull-request@v5
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          commit-message: "chore: bump version (${{ steps.version-detection.outputs.change_type }})"
          title: "Release: Bump version (${{ steps.version-detection.outputs.change_type }})"
          body: |
            ## Version Bump PR
            
            This PR was automatically generated to prepare a new release.
            
            ### Change Type: ${{ steps.version-detection.outputs.change_type }}
            
            ### Changelog:
            ${{ env.CHANGELOG }}
            
            Please review and approve to proceed with the release.
          branch: release/version-bump
          base: main
          labels: release, automated-pr
          
  publish-release:
    needs: prepare-release
    if: github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' || contains(github.event.head_commit.message, 'chore: bump version')
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '16'
          cache: 'npm'
          registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Bump version and create tag
        id: version-bump
        run: |
          # Get current version
          CURRENT_VERSION=${{ needs.prepare-release.outputs.current_version }}
          CHANGE_TYPE=${{ needs.prepare-release.outputs.version_change }}
          
          # Calculate new version
          if [ "$CHANGE_TYPE" = "patch" ]; then
            npm version patch --no-git-tag-version
          elif [ "$CHANGE_TYPE" = "minor" ]; then
            npm version minor --no-git-tag-version
          elif [ "$CHANGE_TYPE" = "major" ]; then
            npm version major --no-git-tag-version
          fi
          
          # Get new version
          NEW_VERSION=$(node -p "require('./package.json').version")
          echo "new_version=$NEW_VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          
          # Create git tag
          git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
          git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
          git add package.json
          git commit -m "chore: release v$NEW_VERSION"
          git tag -a "v$NEW_VERSION" -m "Release v$NEW_VERSION"
          git push --follow-tags
      
      - name: Create GitHub Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v1
        with:
          tag_name: v${{ steps.version-bump.outputs.new_version }}
          name: Release v${{ steps.version-bump.outputs.new_version }}
          body: ${{ env.CHANGELOG }}
          draft: false
          prerelease: false
          
      - name: Publish to NPM
        run: npm publish
        env:
          NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
```

2. Update package.json to include necessary scripts for the release process:
```json
"scripts": {
  "version": "npm run build && git add -A dist",
  "release": "npm run build && npm publish"
}
```

3. Create a CHANGELOG.md template file at the root of the project:
```markdown
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [1.0.0] - YYYY-MM-DD
### Added
- Initial release
```

4. Add documentation in README.md about the release process:
```markdown
## Release Process

This project uses an automated release process via GitHub Actions:

1. When changes are merged to main, a PR is automatically created with version bump and changelog
2. After the PR is approved and merged, a new release is created on GitHub and published to NPM
3. Version numbers follow semantic versioning based on commit messages:
   - `fix:` or bug fixes trigger a patch bump
   - `feat:` or new features trigger a minor bump
   - `BREAKING CHANGE:` or `!:` trigger a major bump
```

5. Configure GitHub repository settings:
   - Add NPM_TOKEN secret to GitHub repository secrets
   - Enable branch protection for main branch requiring PR approvals
   - Configure permissions for GitHub Actions to create releases
